  3. Ben Hope

Ben Hope

Hear pronunciation Press to hear pronunciation

The most northerly of the Munros, Ben Hope is an isolated monolith with a short usual ascent that can be made quickly. The view is of a stunning desolation of lochans and moors.

 You have not climbed Ben Hope.

Region: Sutherland

Altitude: 927 metres

Users' Rating:
  • Currently 3.77/5
Rating: 3.8/5 (99 votes cast)

You must be registered and signed-in to vote

Detailed route description and map

Ben Hope from Strathmore

Other routes and challenges

The obvious alternative is the very steep and challenging north / northeast ridge, which leads up the foot of Loch na Seilg. Much of this offers extremely airy but reasonably straightforward scrambling; there is a 'bad step' (a rock-climb if done directly) near the top which can be avoided to the left (or east) side via a stony gully.

Walker-friendly accommodation in the area

Sutherland Hotels

Sutherland B&B

Sutherland Cottages

Sutherland Hostels
